alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 12:24PM CDT until June 29 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Marshall County in central Illinois... Northeastern Logan County in central Illinois... Woodford County in central Illinois... Northwestern De Witt County in central Illinois... Eastern Tazewell County in central Illinois... McLean County in central Illinois... Northeastern Peoria County in central Illinois... * Until 115 PM CDT. * At 1224 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Rome to Goodfield to near Hopedale, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Carlock and Secor around 1230 PM CDT. Stanford around 1235 PM CDT. Normal, El Paso, Roanoke, Hudson and McLean around 1240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Bloomington, Towanda, Heyworth, Minonk, Lexington, Chenoa, Downs, Cooksville, Le Roy and Colfax. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 10 and 22. Interstate 39 between mile markers 0 and 31. Interstate 55 between mile markers 142 and 187. Interstate 74 between mile markers 106 and 155. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: De Witt; Logan; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford
